recipe.title: Turkey Pho Dip
ingredients: 3 tablespoons hot chili paste (such as sambal oelek)
4 ciabatta or other sturdy sandwich rolls, toasted
Tender herb leaves (such as cilantro, Thai basil, and/or sweet basil), sliced scallions, mung bean sprouts, lime wedges, and sliced jalapeños (for serving)
instructions: Pho Broth: Bring turkey carcass, scallions, ginger, star anise, cinnamon, fish sauce, sugar, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, and 4 qt. water to a boil in a large pot. Reduce heat, skim surface, and simmer until liquid is reduced by nearly half, 2–2 1/2 hours. Strain broth through a fine-mesh sieve into a large saucepan; taste and adjust seasoning with salt if needed.

Bring turkey carcass, scallions, ginger, star anise, cinnamon, fish sauce, sugar, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, and 4 qt. water to a boil in a large pot. Reduce heat, skim surface, and simmer until liquid is reduced by nearly half, 2–2 1/2 hours.
Strain broth through a fine-mesh sieve into a large saucepan; taste and adjust seasoning with salt if needed.

Assembly: Whisk mayonnaise and chili paste in a small bowl to combine. (If you like it extra-spicy, add more chili paste.) Heat leftover turkey in 1 cup pho broth in a medium skillet until warmed through. Assemble sandwiches with rolls, spicy mayonnaise, hoisin sauce, herbs, scallions, and bean sprouts. Serve with lime wedges and jalapeños alongside, as well as a small bowl of warm broth for dipping.
